meanings.definition: Theodicies: Attempts to justify the existence of evil in the world in relation to the existence of a benevolent deity.
meanings.sent1: Many philosophers have written theodicies to explain why bad things happen in a world with a loving god.
meanings.sent2: Scholars often study theodicies to understand how people reconcile the presence of evil with the idea of a kind god.
meanings.sent3: Theodicies can sometimes seem like elaborate excuses for why bad things occur in a supposedly good world.
meanings.sent4: In literature, characters may create theodicies to make sense of the tragedies they face in their lives.
meanings.sent5: The concept of theodicies helps us grapple with the paradox of suffering in a universe governed by a compassionate higher power.
